When showing how the CO2 balloon blocked infrared radiation from their "sun", their results were correct but their premise was wrong. Infrared radiation is produced when the sun's rays hits surfaces on the earth. This radiation is kept from escaping by greenhouse gases. The way this is explained makes it sound like CO2 is blocking heat from the sun. For the results to be easily understood you should probably use an infrared source that isn't a light, and don't call it the sun.
I wouldn't mind a video that corrects and clarifies some of the issues in here, but I don't think the extreme negativity I see in some of the comments is warranted.

Some things I would critique:
Water Vapor is the most prevalent GHG. GWP (Global Warming Potential) isn't calculated because it literally precipitates out. Makes up about 3% of the atmosphere.
CO2 - The base line, has a GWP potential of 1 (at 400 ppm makes up about .04%)
CH4 - methane- has a GWP of 28 - 36 (that is times the heat trapping potential of CO2) (.00017%)
N2O - Nitrous Oxide - 265 to 298 times more potent than CO2. (.00003%)
Chlorofluorocarbons - GWP in the thousands to tens of thousands times that of CO2 (statistically insignificant)

Anyway, earth atmosphere is so much more complicated with the main greenhouse gas being water vapor and CO2 being one of the main limit factor of plants growth (Earth is greening fast thanks to CO2 fertilization but we are still far from optimum, Earth was much nicer during the cretaceous ;-) )
